com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api.configuration

Class WZMediaConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api.configuration.WZMediaConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<WZMediaConfig>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    WZStreamConfig

    public class WZMediaConfig
extends Object
implements Comparable<WZMediaConfig>, Serializable
    The WZMediaConfig class provides configuration properties for the capture and encoding of video and audio
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • ALWAYS_LANDSCAPE

        public static final int ALWAYS_LANDSCAPE
        An identifier for specifying that video should always be sent in landscape orientation. Video that is captured while the video input device or source is in a portrait orientation will be letterboxed.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ALWAYS_PORTRAIT

        public static final int ALWAYS_PORTRAIT
        An identifier for specifying that video should always be sent in portrait orientation. Video that is captured while the video input device or source is in a landscape orientation will be letterboxed.

      • FRAME_SIZE_176x144

        public static final WZMediaConfig FRAME_SIZE_176x144
        An identifier for a preset configuration appropriate for Quarter CIF (QCIF)

        video resolution: 320x240, video bitrate: 280 kbps, framerate: 30 fps, keyframe interval: 30 frames audio sample rate: 44.1kHz, audio bitrate: 64 kbps

        public static final WZMediaConfig FRAME_SIZE_352x288

        public static final WZMediaConfig FRAME_SIZE_640x480

      • rotationToOrientation

        public static int rotationToOrientation(int rotation)
        Converts a surface rotation angle to one of the orientation identifiers.

        ORIENTATION_LANDSCAPE represents 0° followed, in a clockwise manner at 90° increments, by ORIENTATION_PORTRAIT (90°), ORIENTATION_LANDSCAPE_INVERTED (180°), and ORIENTATION_PORTRAIT_INVERTED (270°)

        Parameters:
        rotation - A surface rotation angle, in degrees
        Returns:
        ORIENTATION_LANDSCAPE, ORIENTATION_PORTRAIT, ORIENTATION_LANDSCAPE_INVERTED, or ORIENTATION_PORTRAIT_INVERTED

        Returns:

      • setLowBandwidthScalingFactor

        public void setLowBandwidthScalingFactor(float lowBandwidthScalingFactor)
        The LowBandwidthScalingFactor property is the factor by which to scale the desired bitrate in low bandwidth conditions. Valid range is 0.0 to 1.0; any other value will be ignored. Setting a value of 0.0 indicates that the encoder should choose the best value; setting a value of 1.0 indicates that bitrate will never be throttled.
        Parameters:
        lowBandwidthScalingFactor - The default is 0.75

      • getLowBandwidthScalingFactor

        public float getLowBandwidthScalingFactor()

      • setFrameRateLowBandwidthSkipCount

        public void setFrameRateLowBandwidthSkipCount(int frameRateLowBandwidthSkipCount)
        The FrameRateLowBandwidthSkipCount property is the number of frames to skip when the encoder cannot keep up with the broadcaster. In low bandwidth conditions the encoder will skip frames to conserve bandwidth but still send consistent frames so the encoder can produce smooth playback. The maximum number of frames that can be skipped is equal to the key frame interval minus one - i.e. setting this to 29 with a key frame interval of 30 will produce a key frame only stream, setting to 1 will never skip frames.
        Parameters:
        frameRateLowBandwidthSkipCount - The default is 4 meaning skip 1 of every 4 frames

      • getFrameRateLowBandwidthSkipCount

        public int getFrameRateLowBandwidthSkipCount()

      • setFrameBufferSizeMultiplier

        public void setFrameBufferSizeMultiplier(int frameBufferSizeMultiplier)
        The FrameBufferSizeMultiplier property is the value by which to multiply the video frame rate to derive the number of video frames to buffer before the encoder starts to throttle bitrate and/or frame rate. For example: if the frame rate is 30 and the videoFrameBufferSizeMultiplier is 5, the encoder will buffer 150 (5 * 30) frames before throttling. Setting a value of 0 indicates that the encoder should choose the best value.
        Parameters:
        frameBufferSizeMultiplier - The default value is 4

      • getFrameBufferSizeMultiplier

        public int getFrameBufferSizeMultiplier()

      • setABREnabled

        public void setABREnabled(boolean abrEnabled)
        Enable or disable Adjustable Bitrate (ABR)
        Parameters:
        abrEnabled - true to have the bitrate of the video stream automatically adjusted based on bandwidth constraints, false otherwise

      • isABREnabled

        public boolean isABREnabled()
        Indicates if Adjustable Bitrate (ABR) is enabled or not
        Returns:
        true if the bitrate of the video stream will be automatically adjusted based on bandwidth constraints, false otherwise

      • getVideoFrameSize

        public WZSize getVideoFrameSize()
        Returns the video frame size value
        Returns:
        The video frame size (pixels)

      • setVideoFrameSize

        public void setVideoFrameSize(WZSize videoSize)
        Set the video frame size using the values from the specified instance Frame sizes should always be specified using landscape-based dimensions (i.e. width > height). If the specified size does not represent a landscape-based dimension, the width and height will be swapped so that the resulting dimension is landscape oriented
        Parameters:
        videoSize - An instance with the property values to use

      • setVideoFrameSize

        public void setVideoFrameSize(int width,
                              int height)
        Set the video frame size using the specified values. Frame sizes should always be specified using landscape-based dimensions (i.e. width > height) If the specified size does not represent a landscape-based dimension, the width and height will be swapped so that the resulting dimension is landscape oriented
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the video frame (pixels)
        height - The height of the video frame (pixels)

      • getVideoFrameWidth

        public int getVideoFrameWidth()
        Returns the video frame width
        Returns:
        The video width (pixels)

      • setVideoFrameWidth

        public void setVideoFrameWidth(int width)
        Set the video frame width Frame sizes should always be specified using landscape-based dimensions (i.e. width > height)
        Parameters:
        width - The video frame width (pixels)

      • getVideoFrameHeight

        public int getVideoFrameHeight()
        Returns the video frame height
        Returns:
        The video frame height (pixels)

      • setVideoFrameHeight

        public void setVideoFrameHeight(int height)
        Set the video frame height Frame sizes should always be specified using landscape-based dimensions (i.e. width > height)
        Parameters:
        height - the video height (pixels)

      • getVideoRotation

        public int getVideoRotation()
        Returns the rotation, in degrees, of the video source with 0 being the natural landscape orientation and 90 being the natural portrait orientation 180 and 270 are the inverted landscape and portrait orientations respectively
        Returns:
        the rotation, in degrees, of the device's orientation

      • setVideoRotation

        public void setVideoRotation(int videoRotation)
        Specify the rotation, in degrees, of the video source with 0 being the natural landscape orientation and 90 being the natural portrait orientation 180 and 270 are the inverted landscape and portrait orientations respectively
        Parameters:
        videoRotation - the rotation, in degrees, of the device's orientation

      • getAudioSampleRate

        public int getAudioSampleRate()
        Returns the audio sample rate
        Returns:
        The sample rate (Hz)

      • setAudioSampleRate

        public int setAudioSampleRate(int audioSampleRate)
        Set the the audio sample rate. Note that the list of audio sample rates supported is limited to those in SUPPORTED_AUDIO_SAMPLE_RATES. If a value not in this list is specified, the next highest value from the list of supported sample rates will be used instead.
        Parameters:
        audioSampleRate - The sample rate (Hz)
        Returns:
        The actual sample rate selected from the list of those supported

      • getPresetLabel

        public String getPresetLabel()
        Returns the predefined label describing a preset configuration (e.g. "1080p")
        Returns:
        The preset label or null if this instance is not one of the preset configurations that has a predefined label

      • getPresetLabelByFrameSize

        public String getPresetLabelByFrameSize()
        Returns the predefined label for a preset configuration (e.g. "1080p") that matches this instance by video frame size
        Returns:
        The preset label or null if this instance does not match one of the presets with a predefined label by video frame size

      • getLabel

        public String getLabel(boolean withFrameSize,
                       boolean withPreset,
                       boolean withBitrate)
        Deprecated. 
        See Also:
        getLabel(boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean)

      • getLabel

        public String getLabel(boolean withFrameSize,
                       boolean withPreset,
                       boolean withAspect,
                       boolean withBitrate)
        Return a configurable, human-readable representation of this configuration instance (e.g. "1280x720 (720p) @ 3.5kbps")
        Parameters:
        withFrameSize - indicates if the frame size should be included or not
        withPreset - indicates if the preset label for the frame size should be included or not
        withAspect - indicates if the aspect ratio should be displayed with the frame size or not
        withBitrate - indicates if the video bitrate should be included or not
        Returns:
        string representation of this config
